publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3273 Sandra White: Scotswomen of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates the joint winners of the Evening Times Scotswoman of the Year award, Jean Donnachie and Noreen Real, who, after being left horrified at the treatment of asylum seekers and their families in a series of harrowing dawn raids, set up a community network aimed at ending this inhumane practice; considers that their efforts led to the Home Office abandoning the controversial use of dawn raids, and commends their values of compassion and acceptance. Supported by: Bashir Ahmad*, Robin Harper*, Jamie Hepburn*, Brian Adam*, Alasdair Allan*, Rob Gibson*, Nigel Don*, Aileen Campbell*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Stuart McMillan*, Patrick Harvie*, Jim Tolson*, Christopher Harvie*, Bob Doris*, Christina McKelvie*, Bill Kidd*

S3M-3273 Sandra White: Scotswomen of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates the joint winners of the Evening Times Scotswoman of the Year award, Jean Donnachie and Noreen Real, who, after being left horrified at the treatment of asylum seekers and their families in a series of harrowing dawn raids, set up a community network aimed at ending this inhumane practice; considers that their efforts led to the Home Office abandoning the controversial use of dawn raids, and commends their values of compassion and acceptance. Supported by: Bashir Ahmad, Robin Harper, Jamie Hepburn, Brian Adam, Alasdair Allan, Rob Gibson, Nigel Don, Aileen Campbell, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Stuart McMillan, Patrick Harvie, Jim Tolson, Christopher Harvie, Bob Doris, Christina McKelvie, Bill Kidd, Angela Constance*, Gil Paterson*, Joe FitzPatrick*
S3M-3273 Scotswomen of the Year (lodged on 22 January 2009) Keith Brown*
